title: English Teacher Interview
Interview Descriptions: Process was straightforward and smooth. I had 2 interviewers. The interview was extremely organised. The questions were also mostly standard ones. The quality of our answers is what matters. Overall found the process to be transparent
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult class?

title: Regional Manager Interview
Interview Descriptions: Lasted about an hour. There are 3 panellists. Started with introductory questions to understand more about your motivation and application. This is followed by some behavioural and technical questions. In total, there are about 6 questions.
Interview Questions: Bring us through your application and tell us why you're motivated to join BC

title: Asst Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at British Council (Singapore) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions: Full 1hour session. multiple questions on both hard and soft skills. A few panel people doing the interview. From personal thoughts to handling of situations. List of questions meant to sieve out individuals

title: SCME Interview
Interview Descriptions: 3 rounds, scenario questions. 5 to 6 questions. 3 interviewers. Phone, face to face. Project depending on role. Use pass working exp to answer. Modetately difficult and fast paced. 1 hour interview.

title: Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at British Council (Singapore) in May 2021
Interview Descriptions: Form Submission followed by Online Video Interview once shortlisted. 3 Friendly Interviewers and finished the online interview within 20 mins and proceeded to the next stage of an automated video interview submission.
Interview Questions: Tell us about Yourself. Share a challenge faced during your teaching experience. Describe your teaching style.

title: Teacher Interview
Interview Descriptions: Good - a little lengthy in the written application but very engaging face to face, Met with 2 staff members who were warms and detailed in their responses. Feedback came from the automated system so could have been more detailed
Interview Questions: Work Life balance of an unpredictable schedule

title: Finance Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at British Council
Interview Descriptions: There are three stages to the interview process. Firstly, the selection by the recruiting agent, next a meeting with the hiring manager and lastly a panel interview with HR and hiring manager. I
Interview Questions: One of the concern was cultural adaptability.

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at British Council (Singapore) in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: Quite normal. It was firstly going over CV. And then asking questions about yourself and why you would like to apply for the job and what are your experiences. People are very nice.
Interview Questions: Have you got experience in doing project

title: English Teacher Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at British Council
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and then called in for 30 minute interview face-to-face with 2 interviewers, the boss and assistant head. Asked questions about experience, skills, BC behaviours etc. I received a response 10 days later by email.

title: Business Development Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at British Council (Singapore) in Nov 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online and was tasked to work on a task to write a 500 word business plan to bring a brand new UK product/service into a new East Asian market. Waited 1 week before they came back with confirmation of a phone interview. Was interviewed on the phone by 3 key Directors (who are based in different countries). Questions asked were mainly based on current or past roles/ experiences.
Interview Questions:
- Tell me some innovative sales promotions that you had done previously
- In 3 bullet points, how are you capable of this position? 
- What are the challenges that you think you would face in this role? 
- Have you faced any challenges in your new territories/ markets and how do you overcome them? 
- KPIs- how are you currently measured against? 
- BC has a strict child safety policy- what are your views on it?
